block.p: Celtics 119, Pacers 112

BOSTON, April 25 (AP) -- John Bagley matched his career high of 35 points and got 3 of his 15 assists on Boston's last three overtime baskets as the Celtics took a 2-0 playoff lead with a 119-112 victory today over the Indiana Pacers.
Celtics 119, Pacers 112

BOSTON, April 25 (AP) -- John Bagley matched his career high of 35 points and got 3 of his 15 assists on Boston's last three overtime baskets as the Celtics took a 2-0 playoff lead with a 119-112 victory today over the Indiana Pacers.
The Celtics won their 10th game in a row and 17th of 18 while pushing their winning streak at Boston to 19 games.
They can clinch the three-of-five-game Eastern Conference quarterfinal series by winning on Monday or Thursday night at Indiana.
Bagley, who scored Boston's last 8 points of the third quarter to cut an 86-78 deficit to 88-86, heated up again after the Pacers opened a 108-104 lead with 2 minutes 50 seconds left in overtime.
Indiana's only overtime field goal was Micheal Williams's 3-pointer with 4:24 to go.
Bagley sank an 11-footer with 2:32 remaining. Williams then missed a 3-pointer, and Bagley connected from the right corner, tying the score, 108-108, with 1:53 remaining.

After an offensive foul against Indiana's Detlef Schrempf, Bagley fed Kevin Gamble for the go-ahead jumper from the top of the key with 1:24 to go. Williams missed another 3-pointer with 57 seconds to play and Kevin McHale rebounded.
This time, Bagley missed a layup, but got the offensive rebound and passed to Robert Parish for a layup that put the Celtics on top, 112-108, with 37 seconds remaining.

Indiana's Reggie Miller then sank two free throws, but Bagley made two with 31 seconds left. After Williams missed again, Bagley lobbed the ball to Gamble for a breakaway dunk that made the score 116-110 with 21 seconds remaining. Trail Blazers 101, Lakers 79
PORTLAND, Ore. (AP) -- Kevin Duckworth, the Portland center, had 19 points and 9 rebounds as the Trail Blazers defeated Los Angeles to take a 2-0 lead in their first-round playoff series.
The Blazers can sweep the three-of-five-game series with a victory on the Lakers' court Wednesday night.
A 15-1 run over the final four and a half minutes of the third quarter put Portland on top, 78-55. The Blazers led by as many as 27 as they cruised home.
The Lakers' only point during the run came on a free throw by Byron Scott after Portland's Cliff Robinson drew his second technical foul, for shoving A. C. Green, and was ejected.
Clyde Drexler had 15 points and 10 rebounds but was only 7 for 20 from the field. Terry Porter also scored 15 for the Blazers.
The Lakers, who fell behind by 36 points in the first half before losing, 115-102, Thursday night, stayed within striking distance until the decisive surge.
The Lakers wanted to slow the tempo and succeeded, but it didn't make any difference as Los Angeles shot a 39 percent from the field. Warriors 115, SuperSonics 101

OAKLAND, Calif. (AP) -- Tim Hardaway scored 23 points and Mario Elie ignited Golden State with 17 second-half points to even the three-of-five-game series at one game apiece. Game 3 is scheduled Tuesday in Seattle.

Eddie Johnson scored 22 points and Shawn Kemp had 17 points and 19 rebounds for the Sonics, who were outrebounded, 48-41, by the smaller Warriors. The SuperSonics outrebounded Golden State, 54-32, in their 117-109 victory in Game 1.
Chris Mullin scored 20 points and Sarunas Marciulionis 18 for Golden State, which trailed most of the first half before outscoring Seattle, 30-18, in the third quarter.

A full-scale brawl nearly broke out early in the third period after Alton Lister committed a flagrant foul against Kemp, who retaliated by wrestling Lister to the floor under the Golden State basket. Four other players -- two from each team -- joined the altercation, and all were sent sprawling as Lister and Kemp fell.
BASKETBALL
